N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 50.3 - Who must pay the tax

State Regulations

Section
270 (3)
of the Tax Law
imposes liability for the tax upon the person or persons making or effectuating
the sale or transfer, including the person or persons to whom the sale or
transfer is made. Thus, both transferor and transferee (and also any agent or
broker of either the transferor or the transferee) are liable, and if a
transfer is made on the books of the corporation, it is also liable. The
parties to a transaction may agree which of them shall bear this liability and
payment of the tax by either discharges the liability of both. However, if the
party who has agreed to pay the tax fails to do so, the other party is not
exonerated from liability by such agreement and in such case payment may be
enforced against either party. Notes
